Key Match Events: Trent Alexander-Arnold capped an impressive individual display with a tremendous volley as England beat Bosnia and Herzegovina 3-0.
Cole Palmer’s spot-kick was followed by an excellent Alexander-Arnold effort and late Harry Kane goal.
Eberechi Eze and Palmer produced positive displays on their first England starts.
Ezri Konsa was fouled in the box leading to Palmer's penalty.
Alexander-Arnold scored a superb late volley.
Harry Kane added a goal after Bowen’s shot was blocked on the line.
Watkins forced a save from Vasilj after a neat pass by Palmer.
Pre-Game Insights: Preparations for this summer’s shot at silverware stepped up at St James’ Park as players got a chance to stake their claim for a place on the plane, or even a starting role against Serbia.
Gareth Southgate picked a team of Euro 2024 hopefuls but few impressed enough to book a seat on the plane in a scrappy performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised both Palmer and Eze, saying they played with freedom.
Southgate mentioned that the performance has given him some extra headaches, but that’s a good thing.
Harry Kane called it a really good game and good preparation.
Cole Palmer described scoring his first goal for England as a dream feeling.
Kane praised Palmer’s unbelievable season and mentioned he’s feeling good and should be ready to go for the group stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England managed to secure a win in one of their two warm-up matches before departing for Germany and Euro 2024.
Marc Guehi looked a bit nervous and was shown a yellow card in a friendly for a sub-par challenge.
Trent Alexander-Arnold played some clever passes through the middle and won England a couple of corners.
Eberechi Eze made a strong powerful run between the lines and caused problems for defenders with his movement, pace, and dribbling.
Others: A reminder of the key dates for England ahead of a busy summer: 7 June - final warm-up match against Iceland at Wembley, 8 June - announcement of final 26-man squad, 16 June - opening game of Euro 2024, against Serbia, 20 June - second group game of Euro 2024, against Denmark, 25 June - final game of Euro 2024 group stage, against Slovenia.
